p: Whilst a number of the barriers faced by countries and communities may be planned for and successfully avoided ahead of time, this is not always the case. Given the highly context-specific nature of many of these barriers, they may not always be identifiable a priori, but instead reveal themselves during the implementation phase of an intervention (after initial financial resourcing barriers may have been overcome) [ 20]. The often complex and uncertain nature of the links between climate change and public health mean that linear approaches to adaptation may be more likely to be insufficient.
